intro: Cyrtochilum andreettae, commonly known as the Andreetta's orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, terrestrial growth habit. The plant produces small, intricate flowers with a distinctive coloration, often featuring a mix of white, green, and yellow hues. Cyrtochilum andreettae is adapted to cold and humid environments, typically found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
